short_summary: The Department of National Defence has a requirement for the items detailed below.
description: NOTICE OF PROPOSED PROCUREMENT THE DEPARTMENT OF NATIONAL DEFENCE HAS A REQUIREMENT FOR THE ITEMS DETAILED BELOW.
full_summary:
### Tender Announcement

**Title**: Breathing Apparatus, Oxygen Generating

**Reference Number**: CB-366-23713848

**Solicitation Number**: W8482-253284/A

**Publication Date**: November 21, 2024

**Tender Closing Date**: December 1, 2024, 2:00 PM Eastern Time

**Tender Status**: Open

**UNSPSC Codes**: 46180000, 46181500, 46182500

**Procurement Category**: Goods and Services (GDS)

**Procurement Method**: Competitive Open Bidding

**Purchase Description**: The Department of National Defence is seeking to acquire breathing apparatuses that generate oxygen. The delivery is requested at Canadian Forces Base Halifax.

**Requirements**:

* Item 1: Breathing Apparatus, Oxygen Generating
	+ Quantity: 348 units
	+ Unit of issue: Each
	+ Delivery location: Canadian Forces Base Halifax
* Bidders must provide prices in Canadian dollars.
* Bidders proposing equivalent or substitute products must indicate the brand name, model, and NCAGE number.

**Submission Guidelines**:

* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
* Bids must be submitted electronically through the Canadabuys website.
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

**Contact Information**:

* Jennifer Sorensen, Contracting Officer
* Phone: (555) 555-5555
* Email: [jennifer.sorensen@forces.gc.ca](mailto:jennifer.sorensen@forces.gc.ca)
* Language: English and French

**Financial Information**:

* The Contract will be awarded based on the lowest price among all bids received.

**Electronic Filing Folder**: The complete bid package is available on the Canadabuys website at the above-mentioned URL. Contractors interested in submitting a bid must access the package and follow the guidelines.

Have a nice day and good luck!

Share any suggestions or feedback on how to improve the process for all parties. 

Feedback welcome. Would be happy to discuss
